title: When you realize how old some of the models in League are...

replies.body: This is why Nunu needs the next rework slot after Eve lol.
Would that make him new nunu? then rito fails and he gets reworked again and becomes new-new nunu???

> then rito fails and he gets reworked again and becomes new-new nunu???

No he becomes Ryze.
His ultimate creates an icy portal that channels for 2.5 seconds before transporting all units within 650 units to a location 2000 units away.
Designed to make him less OP in coordinated play but stronger in normal play.

If he turns out to be a bit underwhelming upon release, we're deciding on increasing his level 1 ultimate range by 250 units.

Though we suspect his kit is a bit overtuned, so we are toning down his Q, W, E, and the interactions between them.
Ryunu
We already have Bard Bard and Draven Draven, so why not New-new Nunu.
Newnu

kayle panth an noc are what we call low priority. it should probably happen at some point but it can be put off essentially indefinantly.
Kayle and Panth are both in the top tier for reworks...

https://i.makeagif.com/media/11-05-2015/Cel9RY.gif 

Needs this as his dance too, can't forget that one.
Mind if i add {{champion:117}} to your list?
Mind if I add {{champion:68}} to your Yordle?

This is why VUs need to come back. They may not be as "well received" but some champions honestly deserve justice without necessarily changing their kits.

Unless they plan on reworking nunu, which is possible.
Are you implying that Nunu's kit is absolutely perfect with exactly 0 problems?
I'm not. I'm saying "even though they don't know what to do gameplay wise, they can still make it easier for the eyes."
But if you're going to spend people and time making a new base model, why not hitch gameplay up with it? Otherwise you're delaying others who need Gameplay and Visual at the same time.

If they do a VU, they have a visual base to work off of instead of having to not only overhaul their visuals, but also overhaul the gameplay at the same time. It ends up being possibly more work later, but less work individually.
But if you're going to take away time from a Needed VGU, why not just make it a gameplay update in the first place.

If they have the direction they want to do with the rework and all, they can start on that immediately and do both.

If they don't know *what* to do with him, that's when they should give a VU just so they aren't looking out of place when they're picked. 

The key here is if they have the gameplay direction to take. If they do, VGU away, otherwise it might be good to VU them just as a placeholder until they have something to go for.
